title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Reverting a file in the Java editor is significantly slower than closing and reopening it.
OB: When you answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and then double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the process is quick. However, if I repeat the steps of answering 'no' to save changes and then double-click on the file, and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: Reverting a file in the Java editor using the 'Revert' option should be as fast as closing and reopening it. There should not be a significant delay when using the 'Revert' feature.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a file in the Java editor that has unsaved changes.
2. When prompted to save changes, choose 'no.'
3. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. Note the speed of this action.
4. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
5. This time, instead of double-clicking, right-click on the file and select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
6. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original. This delay should not occur.
